verses.name: Proverbs 28:20
verses.text: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:21
verses.text: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:22
verses.text: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:23
verses.text: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:24
verses.text: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.
